greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: A(n,k) is the number of nonnegative integer matrices with k distinct columns and any number of nonzero rows with column sums n and rows in nonincreasing lexicographic order.
comment: The condition that the rows be in nonincreasing order is equivalent to considering nonequivalent matrices up to permutation of rows
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..209
formula: A(n, k) = Sum_{j=0..k} Stirling1(k, j)*A219727(n, j).
program: D(p, n, k)={my(v=vector(n)); for(i=1, #p, v[p[i]]++); binomial(EulerT(v)[n], k)*k!/prod(i=1, #v, i^v[i]*v[i]!)}
T(n, k)={my(m=n*k, q=Vec(exp(O(x*x^m) + intformal((x^n-1)/(1-x)))/(1-x))); if(n==0, k<=1, sum(j=0, m, my(s=0); forpart(p=j, s+=D(p, n, k), [1, n]); s*q[#q-j]))}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Jan 10 2020
